Dialogs.Text: RedJack44: Let me get this straight...
RedJack44: You had the logs of this ugly argument, and instead of coming to me with them...
RedJack44: You decide it's a better idea to use it in the script of your next video, putting a what should be a server issue in the eyes of the public.
ElChaparro05: Well, the conversation was turning quite racist and nobody was there to stop it...
ElChaparro05: Besides, that user already has a history of doing things like this, so I thought it was good to expose him!
RedJack44: I don't care, that's something you have to report to a mod, or me, and we take care of it.
ElChaparro05: But you are shortstaffed, I think it was the perfect time for me to do what I do best.
AuDol65: Dude, I understand you tried to help, but if the situation became public before the mods could do anything it would look like we don't care of what happens in the server.
AuDol65: Could you please be more careful next time you cover a subject?
ElChaparro05: Ah... Why did you had to show the draft to them, Maki?
MsMaki95: You said I should check it with trustworthy people. n-n
AuDol65: Hehe, thanks Maki. You did well.
RedJack44: I think trust is something we should talk later. Anyway, you are going to have to add clarifications before uploading the video.
RedJack44: This is not the first time you do something like this. I don't forget when you reported on completely false information about nonexistent footage because it sounded cool for a video.
RedJack44: So next time something like this happens, I'm going to kick you from the investigation channels, you understand?
ElChaparro05: I... I understand, sir. I think i'm gonna go to add those clarifications to the draft.
